intro: Schismatoclada humbertiana, commonly known as the Humbert's schismatoclada, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Schismatoclada humbertiana is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
